newsitem.title: USA: ForeFront sets stock buyback, early report.
newsitem.headline: ForeFront sets stock buyback, early report.

text.p: ForeFront Group Inc said Monday directors authorized the repurchase of up to 105,615 shares of its common stock on the open market.
The company also said, in light of recent activity in its share price, it moved the date of its earnings announcement to Wednesday, April 30, from Monday, May 5.
"We are in the throes of a long-running bear market for small-capitalization stocks, and many technology companies have been particularly hard hit," chief executive Dave Sikora explained.

"We remain confident that the fundamentals of the company are quite strong, and we believe that this repurchase plan represents an excellent opportunity to deliver increased value to our shareholders."

The stock to be repurchased represents the maximum amount permitted by accounting standards with respect to a transaction made in 1996, ForeFront said without explanation. Under the plan, share purchases may be made from time to time depending on market and business conditions, and the program may be discontinued or suspended at any time.
"Approval of this program reflects a strong belief in ForeFront's future. We feel that the current valuation in no way reflects the underlying, long-term value of our company," Sikora said.

"While indicators in the Internet applications market have been rather negative, our stock price does not begin to tell the story of our highly profitable PC/Network Products division, which has consistently reported growth of greater than 35 percent," he said.
